content:
The Nikon D500 is a fantastic camera, and a remote shutter release is a great accessory to complement it.

For a Nikon D500, you'll want a remote shutter release that's compatible with the camera's 10-pin remote terminal. Here are some top recommendations:

1. **Nikon MC-36a Multi-Function Remote Cord**: This is Nikon's official remote shutter release, designed specifically for the D500 and other Nikon cameras. It's a high-quality, durable option with a 3-foot cord and a convenient clip-on design. ($17-$20)
2. **Vello RS-N1II Remote Shutter Release**: Vello is a well-known brand in the photography industry, and their RS-N1II is a popular remote shutter release compatible with the Nikon D500. It features a 3-foot cord, a comfortable grip, and a locking mechanism to prevent accidental triggering. ($15-$20)
3. **CamRanger CR-N1 Remote Shutter Release**: CamRanger is a reputable brand that offers a range of remote shutter releases. Their CR-N1 is designed for Nikon cameras, including the D500, and features a 3-foot cord, a compact design, and a locking mechanism. ($20-$25)
4. **Phottix Remote Shutter Release C6**: Phottix is another well-established brand in the photography industry, and their C6 remote shutter release is compatible with the Nikon D500. It features a 3-foot cord, a comfortable grip, and a locking mechanism. ($20-$25)

All of these options are high-quality and reliable, so you can't go wrong with any of them. If you're looking for a more affordable option, you can also consider third-party brands like Neewer or JJC, which offer similar products at a lower price point (around $10-$15).

When choosing a remote shutter release, make sure to check the compatibility with your Nikon D500 and read reviews to ensure it meets your needs.
